entries.meaning: An advantage held by an opponent.
examples: Besides the up-to-date quality of Germany's warships (and her armoured ships had always been so tough as to be virtually unsinkable by gunfire), Germany had two other great counteradvantages.

entries.meaning: A disadvantage that cancels out an advantage.
examples: However, Lijphart is not convinced of the validity of this criticism and points out counteradvantages.
